columns.name: the_geom
columns.description: Geometry

columns.name: SegmentID
columns.description: Street Segment ID from the LION centerline basemap.

columns.name: BoroughCod
columns.description: The borough of the streets segment in one letter format.

columns.name: OFTCode
columns.description: A unique numerical 18 digit code for the On- From- To location of the street segment.

columns.name: OnStreetNa
columns.description: The name of the street for the street rating to be located on.

columns.name: FromStreet
columns.description: The closest intersection to the on street in one direction.

columns.name: ToStreetNa
columns.description: The closest intersection to the on street in the opposite direction.

columns.name: WKT
columns.description: A text markup language for representing vector geometry objects on a map and spatial reference systems of spatial objects.

columns.name: ManualRati
columns.description: The numeric value of the Street Assessment rating on a scale of 1-10, 1 being a low or poor rating and 10 being a high or good rating.

columns.name: RatingLaye
columns.description: Good, Fair, or Poor associated with the numeric rating.

columns.name: Inspection
columns.description: The date the rating information was collected.

columns.name: Shape_STLe
columns.description: The Length of street segment, in miles, as calculated by GIS.

Mayor's Office of Media And Entertainment (MOME)
Mayor's Office of Recovery and Resiliency
Mayor's Office of the Chief Technology Officer (MOCTO)
Mayor’s Office of Community Mental Health (OCMH)
Mayor’s Office to End Domestic and Gender-Based Violence
Office of Administrative Trials and Hearings (OATH)

Office of Film, Theatre, and Broadcasting (FILM)
Port Authority of New York & New Jersey (PANYNJ)
Public Design Commission (formerly Art Commission (ARTCOM) and Design Commission)
fields.name: Agency

view.description:
The Agency performs ongoing assessment of New York City streets. Ratings are based on a scale from 1 to 10, and results are grouped in the following categories:
- Good (%) - ratings of 8 to 10
- Fair (%) - ratings of 4 to 7 (except on local streets where a 7 is good)
- Poor (%) - ratings of 1 to 3.
Inspectors rate street conditions throughout the five boroughs using the scale above.

relatedViews.description:
The Agency performs ongoing assessment of New York City streets. Ratings are based on a scale from 1 to 10, and results are grouped in the following categories:
- Good (%) - ratings of 8 to 10
- Fair (%) - ratings of 4 to 7 (except on local streets where a 7 is good)
- Poor (%) - ratings of 1 to 3.
Inspectors rate street conditions throughout the five boroughs using the scale above.
